places_with_reviews.name: Ancient Shri Madhukeshwara Temple (Banavasi)
places_with_reviews.address: G2P9+43P, Ratha Beedi, Banavasi, Karnataka 581318, India

reviews.text:
One of the oldest temple, around 1200 years old by Kadambas.
Madhukeshwara means honey colour shivalinga.
Nandi is very special here, one eye seeing shivalinga and one more eye is watching parvathi. Nandi is slant here not straight.
In pillars of this temple near nruthya mantapa, we can see both image and mirror image i mean if u put 1 hand,  u will get to see 2 hands.
Saathvi ganapa you have to see in this temple, it is like proof that u visit this temple.

Visiting a heritage place like this, is a positive experience as it allows us to connect with history, appreciate cultural significance, and learn from the past. It fosters a sense of pride, understanding, and preservation of our collective heritage. Loved it.

A wonderful Rock Art temple with beautiful pillars with carvings located in Banavasi which is 25 km far from sirsi. The temples is dedicated to Lord shiva. In main garbhagudi exist madhukeshwar lingam which  is in the color of honey(madhuram). This temple was built by kadamba dynasty which is the oldest Kannada kingdom.

Amazing architecture, if you are interested in historic places this is one place to be around. This temple is from 5th century. The details of the sculptors and overall building architecture is amazing. The advancement at which these temple was constructed tells us how good we were.

Madhukeshwara Temple ( 9th century ) dedicated to Lord Shiva - Situated at Varada river, this ancient temple complex of Banavasi is considered to be the first capital of Karnataka. dated back 375AD. The architecture of the temple is excellent..🙏🏻

places_with_reviews.name: Pampa Vana (ಪಂಪ ವನ)

reviews.text: No maintenance... It's not good to visit in summer... Bcz of no greenery

Pampavana is the sacred place of karwar district, here one of the kadamba empires old temple locate, here we can see some ayurvedic plants,basically its a park,situated very near to the madhukeshwara temple in banavasi.
Place is like abandoned.... Not safe to visit after dark. And location on Google Map is wrong. It is 200 meter before. Perhaps this might be corrected in future.
No maintenance. Need more improvement. Lot of development opportunities are there.
Calm place. Less crowd during week days I believe..

reviews.text:

The Temple administration should work towards cleanliness. Tourists who are visiting shouldn't throw plastic and waste everywhere.

Strict action should be taken. Please maintain lines for Darshana inside the temple. Vehicle parking should be done neatly. Have the proper guidelines inside the temple. Display of temple history has be to be properly everywhere.

Nice devotee place.  Hindu Temple, which is very old and lot of stone carvings are done. Very good and historic Architecture. Peaceful place where there is no much noise and disturbance. It is located in Banavasi, 23kms far from Sirsi Town.

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Aadi Madhukeshwara Devasthana

reviews.text: Banavasi is the oldest town in the Karnataka state. It has grown up around the Madhukeshwara Temple built in the 5th century and dedicated to Shiva the supreme God in Shaivism, a major branch of Hinduism.The town once was the capital of the Kadamba rulers, an ancient royal dynasty of Karnataka. They established themselves there in A.D. 345 and ruled South India for at least two centuries.
Live historic museum feel. So much to know from this place. So well designed temple. Beautiful.

Beautiful sculpture
The temple has rich history And the priest at the temple makes a good effort to educate all tourists about the same.
Best time to visit would be evening
Very ancient beutiful historical place.I want to visit again and again.
A beautiful place. We had a good walk and a good time. Very well made temple considering how old it is.
